A4.text: Dame Agatha Mary Clarissa Christie, Lady Mallowan (née Miller; 15 September 1890 – 12 January 1976), was an English author known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.

A5.text: She is widely regarded as one of the greatest writers, particularly in the mystery genre.

A6.text: She also wrote six romantic novels under the pseudonym Mary Westmacott.

A7.text: Her reputation rests on 66 detective novels and 15 short-story collections that have sold over two billion copies

A8.text: Christie's works, particularly featuring detectives Hercule Poirot or Miss Jane Marple, have given her the title the Queen of Crime, and made her one of the most important and innovative writers in the development of the genre.

A9.text: Her work focused on the spectacle of crime deduction.
